unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop ability in independent and reflective learning through assessing and responding to texts
Identify and discuss fundamental translation theories
Analyze Chinese texts with given contexts
Evaluate and use dictionaries and other tools in translation
Conduct Chinese-English translation within given time

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on translation practice, reflection of their translation practice and going through relevant materials provided in iLearn.

enrolment_rules.description: 80cp at 100 level or above and permission by special approval

assessments.description: Students are expected to take notes when translating and reflect on their translation practice. A reflective journal needs to be submitted.
Students will complete participation tasks online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities.
Students will do a final test on unit content.
Students are expected to present on their translation strategies adopted for their translation
Students are expected to prepare for and participate in class discussions actively.
Students are expected to present on their translation strategies adopted for their translation. This taks will be completed online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit introduces fundamental translation theories and skills and encourages their use in Chinese-English translation practice. Students who enjoy both Chinese and English language proficiency will learn how to analyze and comprehend Chinese texts in various context as well as how to deliver the equivalent message in idiomatic English. Students will also become familiar with translation procedure and be able to identify and solve problems when translating from Chinese into English.
data.title: Chinese-English Translation I

description: This unit introduces fundamental translation theories and skills and encourages their use in Chinese-English translation practice. Students who enjoy both Chinese and English language proficiency will learn how to analyze and comprehend Chinese texts in various context as well as how to deliver the equivalent message in idiomatic English. Students will also become familiar with translation procedure and be able to identify and solve problems when translating from Chinese into English.
title: Chinese-English Translation I
